20int WriteDirectiveOrSeparator(PlatformEmbeddedFileWriterBase* w,
21 int current_line_length,
22 DataDirective directive) {
23 int printed_chars;
24 if (current_line_length == 0) {
25 printed_chars = w->IndentedDataDirective(directive);
26 DCHECK_LT(0, printed_chars);
27 } else {
28 printed_chars = fprintf(w->fp(), ",");
29 DCHECK_EQ(1, printed_chars);
30 }
31 return current_line_length + printed_chars;
32}
33
34int WriteLineEndIfNeeded(PlatformEmbeddedFileWriterBase* w,
35 int current_line_length, int write_size) {
36 static const int kTextWidth = 100;
37 // Check if adding ',0xFF...FF\n"' would force a line wrap. This doesn't use
38 // the actual size of the string to be written to determine this so it's
39 // more conservative than strictly needed.
40 if (current_line_length + strlen(",0x") + write_size * 2 > kTextWidth) {
41 fprintf(w->fp(), "\n");
42 return 0;
43 } else {
44 return current_line_length;
45 }
46}
47
48} // namespace
49
50void EmbeddedFileWriter::WriteBuiltin(PlatformEmbeddedFileWriterBase* w,
51 const i::EmbeddedData* blob,
52 const Builtin builtin) const {
53 const bool is_default_variant =
54 std::strcmp(embedded_variant_, kDefaultEmbeddedVariant) == 0;
55
56 base::EmbeddedVector<char, kTemporaryStringLength> builtin_symbol;
57 if (is_default_variant) {
58 // Create nicer symbol names for the default mode.
59 base::SNPrintF(builtin_symbol, "Builtins_%s", i::Builtins::name(builtin));
60 } else {
61 base::SNPrintF(builtin_symbol, "%s_Builtins_%s", embedded_variant_,
62 i::Builtins::name(builtin));
63 }
64
65 // Labels created here will show up in backtraces. We check in
66 // Isolate::SetEmbeddedBlob that the blob layout remains unchanged, i.e.
67 // that labels do not insert bytes into the middle of the blob byte
68 // stream.
69 w->DeclareFunctionBegin(builtin_symbol.begin(),
70 blob->InstructionSizeOf(builtin));
71 const int builtin_id = static_cast<int>(builtin);
72 const std::vector<uint8_t>& current_positions = source_positions_[builtin_id];
73 // The code below interleaves bytes of assembly code for the builtin
74 // function with source positions at the appropriate offsets.
75 base::Vector<const uint8_t> vpos(current_positions.data(),
76 current_positions.size());
77 v8::internal::SourcePositionTableIterator positions(
78 vpos, SourcePositionTableIterator::kExternalOnly);
79
80#ifndef DEBUG
81 CHECK(positions.done()); // Release builds must not contain debug infos.
82#endif
83
84 // Some builtins (InterpreterPushArgsThenFastConstructFunction,
85 // JSConstructStubGeneric) have entry points located in the middle of them, we
86 // need to store their addresses since they are part of the list of allowed
87 // return addresses in the deoptimizer.
88 const std::vector<LabelInfo>& current_labels = label_info_[builtin_id];
89 auto label = current_labels.begin();
90
91 const uint8_t* data =
92 reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t*>(blob->InstructionStartOf(builtin));
93 uint32_t size = blob->PaddedInstructionSizeOf(builtin);
94 uint32_t i = 0;
95 uint32_t next_source_pos_offset =
96 static_cast<uint32_t>(positions.done() ? size : positions.code_offset());
97 uint32_t next_label_offset = static_cast<uint32_t>(
98 (label == current_labels.end()) ? size : label->offset);
99 uint32_t next_offset = 0;
100 while (i < size) {
101 if (i == next_source_pos_offset) {
102 // Write source directive.
103 w->SourceInfo(positions.source_position().ExternalFileId(),
104 GetExternallyCompiledFilename(
105 positions.source_position().ExternalFileId()),
106 positions.source_position().ExternalLine());
107 positions.Advance();
108 next_source_pos_offset = static_cast<uint32_t>(
109 positions.done() ? size : positions.code_offset());
110 CHECK_GE(next_source_pos_offset, i);
111 }
112 if (i == next_label_offset) {
113 WriteBuiltinLabels(w, label->name);
114 label++;
115 next_label_offset = static_cast<uint32_t>(
116 (label == current_labels.end()) ? size : label->offset);
117 CHECK_GE(next_label_offset, i);
118 }
119 next_offset = std::min(next_source_pos_offset, next_label_offset);
120 WriteBinaryContentsAsInlineAssembly(w, data + i, next_offset - i);
121 i = next_offset;
122 }
123
124 w->DeclareFunctionEnd(builtin_symbol.begin());
125}
126
127void EmbeddedFileWriter::WriteBuiltinLabels(PlatformEmbeddedFileWriterBase* w,
128 std::string name) const {
129 if (ENABLE_CONTROL_FLOW_INTEGRITY_BOOL) {
130 w->DeclareSymbolGlobal(name.c_str());
131 }
132
133 w->DeclareLabel(name.c_str());
134}
135
136void EmbeddedFileWriter::WriteCodeSection(PlatformEmbeddedFileWriterBase* w,
137 const i::EmbeddedData* blob) const {
138 w->Comment(
139 "The embedded blob code section starts here. It contains the builtin");
140 w->Comment("instruction streams.");
141 w->SectionText();
142
143#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_IA32 || V8_TARGET_ARCH_X64
144 // UMA needs an exposed function-type label at the start of the embedded
145 // code section.
146 static const char* kCodeStartForProfilerSymbolName =
147 "v8_code_start_for_profiler_";
148 static constexpr int kDummyFunctionLength = 1;
149 static constexpr int kDummyFunctionData = 0xcc;
150 w->DeclareFunctionBegin(kCodeStartForProfilerSymbolName,
151 kDummyFunctionLength);
152 // The label must not be at the same address as the first builtin, insert
153 // padding bytes.
154 WriteDirectiveOrSeparator(w, 0, kByte);
155 w->HexLiteral(kDummyFunctionData);
156 w->Newline();
157 w->DeclareFunctionEnd(kCodeStartForProfilerSymbolName);
158#endif
159
160 w->AlignToCodeAlignment();
161 w->DeclareSymbolGlobal(EmbeddedBlobCodeSymbol().c_str());
162 w->DeclareLabel(EmbeddedBlobCodeSymbol().c_str());
163
164 static_assert(Builtins::kAllBuiltinsAreIsolateIndependent);
165 for (ReorderedBuiltinIndex embedded_index = 0;
166 embedded_index < Builtins::kBuiltinCount; embedded_index++) {
167 Builtin builtin = blob->GetBuiltinId(embedded_index);
168 WriteBuiltin(w, blob, builtin);
169 }
170 w->AlignToPageSizeIfNeeded();
171 w->Newline();
172}
173
174void EmbeddedFileWriter::WriteFileEpilogue(PlatformEmbeddedFileWriterBase* w,
175 const i::EmbeddedData* blob) const {
176 {
177 base::EmbeddedVector<char, kTemporaryStringLength>
178 embedded_blob_code_size_symbol;
179 base::SNPrintF(embedded_blob_code_size_symbol,
180 "v8_%s_embedded_blob_code_size_", embedded_variant_);
181
182 w->Comment("The size of the embedded blob code in bytes.");
183 w->SectionRoData();
184 w->AlignToDataAlignment();
185 w->DeclareUint32(embedded_blob_code_size_symbol.begin(), blob->code_size());
186 w->Newline();
187
188 base::EmbeddedVector<char, kTemporaryStringLength>
189 embedded_blob_data_size_symbol;
190 base::SNPrintF(embedded_blob_data_size_symbol,
191 "v8_%s_embedded_blob_data_size_", embedded_variant_);
192
193 w->Comment("The size of the embedded blob data section in bytes.");
194 w->DeclareUint32(embedded_blob_data_size_symbol.begin(), blob->data_size());
195 w->Newline();
196 }
197
198#if defined(V8_OS_WIN64)
199 {
200 base::EmbeddedVector<char, kTemporaryStringLength> unwind_info_symbol;
201 base::SNPrintF(unwind_info_symbol, "%s_Builtins_UnwindInfo",
202 embedded_variant_);
203
204 w->MaybeEmitUnwindData(unwind_info_symbol.begin(),
205 EmbeddedBlobCodeSymbol().c_str(), blob,
206 reinterpret_cast<const void*>(&unwind_infos_[0]));
207 }
208#endif // V8_OS_WIN64
209
210 w->FileEpilogue();
211}
212
213// static
214void EmbeddedFileWriter::WriteBinaryContentsAsInlineAssembly(
215 PlatformEmbeddedFileWriterBase* w, const uint8_t* data, uint32_t size) {
216 int current_line_length = 0;
217 uint32_t i = 0;
218
219 // Begin by writing out byte chunks.
220 const DataDirective directive = w->ByteChunkDataDirective();
221 const int byte_chunk_size = DataDirectiveSize(directive);
222 for (; i + byte_chunk_size < size; i += byte_chunk_size) {
223 current_line_length =
224 WriteDirectiveOrSeparator(w, current_line_length, directive);
225 current_line_length += w->WriteByteChunk(data + i);
226 current_line_length =
227 WriteLineEndIfNeeded(w, current_line_length, byte_chunk_size);
228 }
229 if (current_line_length != 0) w->Newline();
230 current_line_length = 0;
231
232 // Write any trailing bytes one-by-one.
233 for (; i < size; i++) {
234 current_line_length =
235 WriteDirectiveOrSeparator(w, current_line_length, kByte);
236 current_line_length += w->HexLiteral(data[i]);
237 current_line_length = WriteLineEndIfNeeded(w, current_line_length, 1);
238 }
239
240 if (current_line_length != 0) w->Newline();
241}
242
243int EmbeddedFileWriter::LookupOrAddExternallyCompiledFilename(
244 const char* filename) {
245 auto result = external_filenames_.find(filename);
246 if (result != external_filenames_.end()) {
247 return result->second;
248 }
249 int new_id =
250 ExternalFilenameIndexToId(static_cast<int>(external_filenames_.size()));
251 external_filenames_.insert(std::make_pair(filename, new_id));
252 external_filenames_by_index_.push_back(filename);
253 DCHECK_EQ(external_filenames_by_index_.size(), external_filenames_.size());
254 return new_id;
255}
256
257const char* EmbeddedFileWriter::GetExternallyCompiledFilename(
258 int fileid) const {
259 size_t index = static_cast<size_t>(ExternalFilenameIdToIndex(fileid));
260 DCHECK_GE(index, 0);
261 DCHECK_LT(index, external_filenames_by_index_.size());
262
263 return external_filenames_by_index_[index];
264}
265
266int EmbeddedFileWriter::GetExternallyCompiledFilenameCount() const {
267 return static_cast<int>(external_filenames_.size());
268}
269
270void EmbeddedFileWriter::PrepareBuiltinSourcePositionMap(Builtins* builtins) {
271 for (Builtin builtin = Builtins::kFirst; builtin <= Builtins::kLast;
272 ++builtin) {
273 // Retrieve the SourcePositionTable and copy it.
274 Tagged<Code> code = builtins->code(builtin);
275 if (!code->has_source_position_table()) continue;
276 Tagged<TrustedByteArray> source_position_table =
277 code->source_position_table();
278 std::vector<unsigned char> data(source_position_table->begin(),
279 source_position_table->end());
280 source_positions_[static_cast<int>(builtin)] = data;
281 }
282}
283
284void EmbeddedFileWriter::PrepareBuiltinLabelInfoMap(int create_offset,
285 int invoke_offset) {
286 label_info_[static_cast<int>(Builtin::kJSConstructStubGeneric)].push_back(
287 {create_offset, "construct_stub_create_deopt_addr"});
288 label_info_[static_cast<int>(
289 Builtin::kInterpreterPushArgsThenFastConstructFunction)]
290 .push_back({invoke_offset, "construct_stub_invoke_deopt_addr"});
291}
